inclusion.criterion: Women aged 18-85 with history of recurrent urinary tract infections.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Definition of Recurrent UTI: if experienced either more than 3 symptomatic UTI episodes in the past year (including the index infection) or 2 such episodes in the past 6 months.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Definition of UTI: >103 cfu/mL of a uropathogen in midstream urine culture from a woman experiencing more than 2 symptoms of cystitis (dysuria, urgency, frequency, suprapubic pain, or hematuria) or, in the absence of a culture, demonstration of pyuria on urinalysis and more than 2 urinary symptoms, as well as complete and rapid resolution of symptoms in response to antibiotic therapy for UTI.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Taking any anticoagulant such as warfarin sodium, heparin
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Known aneurysm, thrombocytopenia, hemorrhagic disease, hemophilia, gastrointestinal ulceration, polyps, or diverticula
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of recurrent UTIs and is taking antibiotics for the current infection. However, they have a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter and are experiencing significant leaking around the suprapubic cath site.
